website_summaries.verdict: Affordable sealant that gets you back on the road fast.
cons: Won't work on sidewall punctures or bead-seal leaks

customer_reviews.title: but this stuff works great. My wife is a flat magnet
customer_reviews.text: Don’t usually review items, but this stuff works great. My wife is a flat magnet, and I just used this to seal a previous, center of tread patch in her run flats. Since it had already been plug patched BMW nor my local would attempt to re-patch it. One bottle of this 2 weeks ago, rock solid psi. Also used a bottle to treat an invisible leak on another car. I keep a bottle handy in my M5 since they don’t have real spares.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Nacamuli

customer_reviews.title: SEALED SLOW AUTO TIRE LEAK
customer_reviews.text: I was losing about 1 psi per day in a front tire. Examined it for nails screws, etc. and found none and the tire's only good for another 6 mo. (have 33k miles on it). I added some slime, and it slowed the leak down to about 2-3 psi per week, which since I have a 2 hp compressor in the garage is no problem. Most interesting is that the leak has become slower as time progresses and that when first getting up to highway speed there is a noticeable imbalance in that tire, but only for a few miles.
customer_reviews.author: Geldscheisser

customer_reviews.title: Sidewwall cracks
customer_reviews.text: Two old tires with cracked sidewalls that I figured needed tubes or total replacement. Front tire on JD riding mower and one tire on mobile chicken coop. Immersed them in water and saw air leaking from sidewall cracks. Put in the Slime, inflated them, laid them on their sides for a while and whaddayaknow. Leaks gone. This is excellent stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Ruined My Tire
customer_reviews.text: Had air leaking and figured this would be a quick easy patch. Worst. Mistake. Ever. It was a nightmare trying to get all of the goo in the tire. Then after about a week I noticed it was low again.... Then today my tire literally busted off. The mechanic said the patch had unevenly collected in the tire and caused this to happen. Now I’m spending $100 for a new tire. Even though I followed the instructions and drove around slow after filling the tire with the goo, something went wrong. I would just go to a professional and get a real patch done.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever - Removing valve and manually squeeze in fix-a-flat goo
customer_reviews.text: Worst product ever - Removing valve and manually squeeze in fix-a-flat goo Once you remove the tire valve, there's no guarantee it will work the same or chance it will ever be able to be replaced. Waste of money to save a few bucks for the regular, normal, standard fix-a-flat bottles you simply screw in, press, and let areosole pressure do it all, in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Frank James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, great value!
customer_reviews.text: Had a flat tire on my L100 series John Deere riding mower. I inherited the mower when I bought my house so I have no idea how many hours are on the engine. Didn't want to sink money into replacing the tires so thought I would try this. Tire could hold air well enough to mow my lawn, but would be completely flat next time I went to mow. Followed the easy to understand directions on the bottle, used about half the bottle and the tire has held air for 6 weeks since application. Very pleased overall
customer_reviews.author: JAN-MICHAEL HESSENAUER

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my stroller wheel in minutes
customer_reviews.text: My Joovy Zoom 360 stroller rear wheel was leaking and the wheel tubes were out of stock. Joovy customer service suggested this product and it worked perfectly. We fixed the flat on my stroller almost 2 months ago and I haven't had to fill it with air since (I use my stroller 5-6 times a week). Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: K.M.K.

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: My front passenger side tire was slowly leaking air (would go from 35 psi to 22 psi in two weeks or so) and I cannot afford another tire right this second so I purchased this. And, boy, does it work! Completely stopped the leak (for now. I still definitely plan on buying a tire asap as this is not a permanent fix-as it states that clearly on the bottle.) Not only does it do its job, but it works overtime as well! Recommend 100%!
customer_reviews.author: Haley Skye

customer_reviews.title: Product completely deteriorated during storage or shipping
customer_reviews.text: Product completely deteriorated during storage or shipping. It is supposed to be bright green and instead it is dark green with clumps and some watery substance around. Impossible to use.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: This has worked when I needed it
customer_reviews.text: I had a fairly new tire with no obvious holes that was losing about 10 psi a week. I used a bottle of this and haven't lost pressure in about 1000 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Torc

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my pressure washer tires
customer_reviews.text: My pressure washer tires kept going flat. I added this stuff and the problem is solved. This saved me from having to make expensive repair on tires that only need to roll around at walking speed. I can't speak for how this product works at highway speed, but for my purpose it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Just JimTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It is for emergency use.
customer_reviews.text: Never used it. Bought for emergency use which is precisely what it is sold as. How do I know how it is until a tire goes flat? Your request to evaluate this product is therefore just plain stupid.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Worked on rim leaks on utility tire rim although not advertised as such.
customer_reviews.text: Repaired both wheels on my hand truck with leaks at rims. Pulled back tire from edge and applied directly to edge spreading manually (both sides both wheels}. Easy and holds up after a week so it is solid..
customer_reviews.author: Rick W

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I had a slow leak on a tire that had a good amount of tread still on it. I did not need to replace the tire so I bought a bottle of slime. It was easy to use and the tire has not leaked since I installed the slime. Stuff works I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Worked on small, slow car tire leak
customer_reviews.text: Have only used this brand on small tires before (bicycle, wheelbarrow, etc.) but the car tire had a super slow, small leak (lose 5-10 psi over 2-3 weeks). This seems to have fixed the problem.
customer_reviews.author: C Kole Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Use it for all my equip (golf cart, lawn mowers, ATVs, bicycles, etc..) I've even used it in my truck for a tire that would go low every few days.
customer_reviews.author: William Parker

customer_reviews.title: Stopped the Leak!
customer_reviews.text: Just follow the directions and the Green Slime will stop the leak. Keep an extra bottle and a small air pump in the trunk when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: david a yarborough

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t always work
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me. Put whole bottle in a golf cart tire because I couldn’t find a puncture. Tire still deflated even after several days of rotating, flipping and inflating with wheel off the cart.
customer_reviews.author: superstition1

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I had used this multiple times for flat tires and it does it's job every time. This is something that I keep in my car at all times.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I tried using it on John Deere garden tractor and it did not work. It’s a tubeless tire with rates for 18 pounds of pressure. I tried half the can at first and when that didn’t work I used the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lawn tractor tire fixed with slime
customer_reviews.text: Ran over a huge spike while cutting the grass. Pulled it out and used the slime. Worked great. Easy to use. I recommend buying a valve removal kit rather than using the cap to remove the valve.
customer_reviews.author: The Dad

customer_reviews.title: Its slime
customer_reviews.text: Its slime, doesn't need reviewed, if there is a hole then it fills it, not rocket science.
customer_reviews.author: Josh T

customer_reviews.title: Fast fix cool tool I keep a can on my HD
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use works fast don’t know how long it will last but right now I’ll recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Nick Cali

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: I just hope I never need it. But I have used it in the past. It works well.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Very good fix
customer_reviews.text: works great on my older lawn tractor tires. One bottle per tire.
customer_reviews.author: Arzeb

customer_reviews.title: Super slime
customer_reviews.text: This stuff saved me from purchasing a new tire. Of course the dealer said I needed a $300 + dollar new tire because of a screw. This stuff plugged the whole and NO ISSUES what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: Won by one

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly ride
customer_reviews.text: Good temporary fix. Causes an unbalanced tire\ride wobble at high speeds
customer_reviews.author: Drk9ght

customer_reviews.title: Made no difference for my flat
customer_reviews.text: I used this to repair a flat. I followed the instructions to the letter. To no avail. Tire began loosing air immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan WellsTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: TPMS SAFE TIRE GOOP
customer_reviews.text: No spare from factory, prefer not to destroy expensive run flat tires if can be helped. TPMS safe
customer_reviews.author: Hashu Deikus

customer_reviews.title: Better envolope needed
customer_reviews.text: Envolope was sealed but was open on the side. Obviously had tore open and the slime fell out.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought a used jogging stroller off Craigslist - the person I bought it from noted he has used slime with great success before so I ordered some to have on hand. Murphy's law: first time taking the stroller out we got a flat. Followed the instructions and no more flat! Huzzah!
customer_reviews.author: dave minamoto

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: Never used this before. Thought I'd give it a try. Had 3 tires on my lawnmower with slow leaks. Took about 5 mins and now no more having to air up the tires before I mow. Would recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Green is Great
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, easy to use and very effective for small leaks....good stuff!

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me..
customer_reviews.text: Had two tires that were older, but with a lot of tread left. They seemed to have slow leaks around the rims.. this fixed it..

customer_reviews.title: Slime works great! (Never thought I'd say THAT!)
customer_reviews.text: Slime works great! Had a mower tire that I had to air up every time I needed to mow. Used this one time and haven't had to air the tire up since (several months now). Easy to apply, works like a charm. The bottle we used was a gift from a friend, but we have since bought two more to keep in our vehicles. Great stuff. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K.O.

customer_reviews.title: Simply put, it works.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this many times and it always works without fail.

customer_reviews.title: worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I used this product before to repair a lawn tractor tire. I had bought the sealant in an automotive store. Seeing how easy it was to use, I went to the Amazon web site and order one as a spare. I highly recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: It worked very well.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to keep air in the tubeless tires on the front of my zero turn mower until I tried this. It was super easy to use and worked immediately. I'm glad I tried this a

customer_reviews.text: Not happy - bought to fix a very slow leak, used as directed and it's still leaking!!

customer_reviews.title: Get this one item and save yourself a world of pain.
customer_reviews.text: Just buy a Valve Core Tool Set. The Valve core remover provided is crap. Otherwise GREAT product.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bit more of a hassle to remove the tire valve stem, but well worth it to get as much of the product into the tire. Filled with air and hasn’t leaked in weeks.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for us
customer_reviews.text: This stuff worked for our RX-350. Caught a blade from a box knife and thought the hole was too big for this stuff to work, but a week later and the tire has not lost any air at all.
customer_reviews.author: S. C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: This stuff worked great on two lawn mower tires that kept going flat every couple of weeks. It's been over a month now and both are holding air perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: WiscoHunter

customer_reviews.title: Had an old rim that had corrosion around the valve ...
customer_reviews.text: Had an old rim that had corrosion around the valve stem hole and it was leaking air through this hole. I first tried to just use some RTV but that didn't work so I added a bottle of this and it sealed up right away.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor decision
customer_reviews.text: I used it and my tire flattened faster than it did before.🤦🏽‍♀️🤦🏽‍♀️🤦🏽‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seals tire but throws balance off pretty bad unlike Ride-on. But, its good for a quick fix.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Fixed a slow leak that I could not find in one of the tires of my side by side. Was a bit Leary at first but it works!

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I had a slow leak on my motorcycle tire where it had been plugged. I installed this Slime and rode it bout half a mile and checked it,no more leak. The best thing about this product is when you break down the tire to replace it is there not the mess with cleanup as with other products of this kind.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Joe

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I used it to seal my dolly's wheel that had a leak and worked instantly to inflate it. So far after several weeks, still holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: ScottyTreehouse

customer_reviews.title: I have used this before and it is a great solution to fixing my riding mower tire and wheel ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this before and it is a great solution to fixing my riding mower tire and wheel barrow tire that has that slow leak. I really don't care what the inside of the tire looks like, I just want it to stay inflated when I use them and this is the trick!

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: Tire repair men hate it. I love it cause I never have to see a tire repairman.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible, don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Product didn't work....had a very very small screw in tire tread..removed screw like directions said. Added sealant inflated and drove and it all came out and tire flat in a minute

customer_reviews.text: The cap that doubled as a "tool" that is supposed to remove valve stem core was pretty much worthless. Other than that it is a decent product

customer_reviews.text: This worked *perfectly* - I emptied half this bottle into the front tire of my John Deer x300, and it completely revived the tire. Incredible!

customer_reviews.text: I had a flat on my mini bike and could not find the leak, used half the bottle and next day the tire kept air pressure.

customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fix a puncture on my compact tractor tire. I also bought the Slime plug strips too. Together they worked perfect! This product might work well by itself, I didn't try that first.

customer_reviews.text: I've used this product on a tractor and have had great results. I believe if you can patch a tire that is absolutely the best repair, but sometimes it's just not possible, so I rely on this and would recommend it to all.

customer_reviews.title: Good one

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: I have a utility cart whose two front tires started leaking a lot of air after being exposed to the weather. I used this product about 1/3 bottle for both wheels. No more leaking.

customer_reviews.text: The only available solution for punctured Onewheel tires (and recommended by future motion customer support)

customer_reviews.text: Slime saved me from a mess with my boat trailer. We loaded up at boat ramp after week long camping trip to find the forward tire flat. Put in slime inflate and brought the 6000 lbs rig 180 miles home without issue.

customer_reviews.text: Slime work's great, I bought some cooper tire's for an old car I have and they don't seat right because of the hard rubber and old rim's. I put 16 oz's in and they hold air now, I live in the back wood's so it don't matter to me if the tire's are off balance a little. I can't really tell if it make's a difference. A newer car and driving on the highway all the time I would have replaced the rim's and I wouldn't buy cooper tire's. Slime wok's great in wheel barrel's and riding lawn mower's too. Just make sure the tire's are tubeless.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Summering

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It worked great! One 16oz bottle took care of two lawn tractor tires. They've held for several weeks and counting!

customer_reviews.text: Used half the bottle on the two tires on my hand cart . They were leaking bad. Stopped the leak almost instanly & the tires are still not leaking.

customer_reviews.text: Worked great on my lawn tractor tire. Just make sure you do it before you are going to mow the lawn or drive for a long while so the slime can take hold.

customer_reviews.title: ... bottle in each of two golf cart tires looks like it might work for dry rot on sidewalls in ...

customer_reviews.text: Just put in Snow thrower tire. We will see if it is still inflated next winter

customer_reviews.title: Great to fix a flat
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on fixing my flat tire. Easy to use. I think it ruins the tire so the mechanic can't repair it, but I didn't need to bring it in.
customer_reviews.author: LHaynes

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. I had a slight leak in one of my rear tires (my car is front wheel drive) that would take about a week to lose 10 psi. I added the recommended amount of slime (16 oz in my case). Now about a month later, I've noticed that the tire still drains at the same rate. I've check the valve and the problem is not there. I don't drive on any high speed roads so that's not the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey Yurkin

customer_reviews.title: Slime works good on bicycle tires too.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my bicycles and it worked perfect, plus the auto tire slime is cheaper too.
customer_reviews.author: J's Purchases

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great item, works well and is priced right. Would buy again!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stuff really does work. I used it on a ...
customer_reviews.text: Stuff really does work. I used it on a lawn tractor tire, and it solved the leak I got from a nail puncture.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff K.

customer_reviews.title: A bit different than expected but it works
customer_reviews.text: I anticipated that this was a glue type of product that spread on the inside and dried over the hole. But it is a liquid product that does not dry, but simply holds small pieces of particles that when placed in the tire and allowed to spread over the hole, the particles from the liquid fill the hole and plug it when air pressure is applied. Not what I expected but it does work and is easy to use. The valve tool inside the cap is especially helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey K DeWeese

customer_reviews.title: I had a bad puncture in a tire that still leaked after a ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a bad puncture in a tire that still leaked after a plug/patch. I added the slime and it never leaked again. Saved me from having to buy tires a year early.
customer_reviews.author: Ida S.

customer_reviews.title: Works to plug slow leaks
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a tire that had a slow leak. It would loose about one psi per day. I used half the bottle and it was enough to plug the slow leak. It's been 4 weeks and so far so good. The slime does cause vibrations in the tire but only at high speeds (>90 mph). Below that, I find no adverse effect on drivability.
customer_reviews.author: Ayayou

customer_reviews.title: Stopped our leaking tire
customer_reviews.text: I had a slow-leaking tire that had gotten to the point where it needed to be filled with air once every week. Order the Slime, put the whole 16oz into the tire when it was deflated (the tire is on a Lexus ES300 sedan), filled it back up, and haven't had to put any air in it since. It's been about 2 months and the slime is still doing it's job, so I couldn't ask for anything more.
customer_reviews.author: Siannopollo

product_meta.title: Slime 10011 Emergency Tire Repair Sealant, 16 oz. (Car/Trailer)
product_meta.description: No more flats! Slime's Emergency Tire Sealant seeks out and instantly seals tread area punctures in automotive tires up to 1/4" (6mm). When a puncture occurs, Slime’s patented sealant is carried directly to the source. The pressure of the escaping air forces the particles into the opening, where they build up and intertwine to form a long-lasting, flexible plug. Instantly, air loss is blocked and a flat tire is prevented. No jack is needed to repair your flat tire, and the sealant is safe and easy to use. Don’t rely on roadside assistance (which can take up to an hour to arrive, leaving you in a dangerous situation) or on your spare tire (which is usually cracked or flat from lack of use). Instead install Slime in any of your highway vehicles (including cars, trucks, SUVs, RVs, trailers and much more) when you get an emergency flat tire to get back on the road quickly and safely.
feature_bullets: Instantly seals up to 1/4" (6mm) punctures (about the size of a large screw or nail)
No jack required to repair your flat tire
Easy to use and safe for both you and the environment
Great for use in an emergency flat tire situation on highway vehicle tires. Use it instead of roadside assistance or installing a spare tire
